form_title.ms_form_title_llm_v1: UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE IMMIGRATION AND NATURALIZATION SERVICE ( Form I-353 BOND CONDITIONED FOR THE DELIVERY OF AN ALIEN

full_text: Screened by NARA, 9/18/2023 Form I-353 UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE IMMIGRATION AND NATURALIZATION SERVICE (Rev. 1-26-53) BOND CONDITIONED FOR THE DELIVERY OF AN ALIEN (NOTE.-Instructions on Form I-308 should be strictly followed in preparing this bond) BRSSH MAR DOO aka MAR AU SANG TOTOPE (Name of alien) EVIE TALEBELL September 26 19 56 , APPROVED AND ACCEPTED. Edw I EDW. J. SHAUGHNESSY Shanshing District Director M New York District A10 294 862 Officer in Charge. KNOW ALL MEN BY THESE PRESENTS: 1 That WE, I, NG LIM 2 residing at 40 Division Street, New York, N. Y. 3 and 4 residing at 5 are held and firmly bound unto the UNITED STATES OF AMERICA, in the full and just sum of 6 One Thousand dollars 1000.00 ), as liquidated damages and not as a 7 penalty, to be paid to the United States, for which payment well and truly to be made, without relief from valua- 8 tion or appraisement laws, we, and each of us, do bind ourselves, our heirs, executors, administrators, successors, 9 and assigns, jointly and severally, firmly by these presents. 10 Sealed with our seals and dated this 26th day of September 19 56. , 11 WHEREAS, MAR DOO aka MAR AU SANG an alien, aged 48 years, 12 a native of China , who arrived at the port of Boston, Mass. 13 per on the 30th day of April 19 55, 14 has been placed under arrest under the provisions, of the immigration laws of the United States on warrant of 15 the Attorney General, issued on the 25th day of September , 19 56, 16 on the charge that he is unlawfully within the United States; 17 AND WHEREAS, the said alien has applied for release from custody upon giving a bond in accordance with 18 section 242 of the Immigration and Nationality Act; 19 Now, THEREFORE, in the event the said alien is released from custody either pending final determination of 20 the alien's deportability or after a final order of deportation has been made, the conditions of this obligation are 21 that (1) if the above-bounder obligors, or either of them, shall cause the said alien to be produced or to produce 22 himself to an officer of the United States Immigration and Naturalization Service, hereinafter called an "Immigra- 23 tion Officer," upon and pursuant to his request or that of any other immigration officer, for the purpose of defend- 24 ing himself or herself against the charge or charges under which the said alien has been taken into custody and any 25 other charges which subsequently are lodged against the alien or for detention or for such other reason provided 26 for by regulation as the immigration officer making the request shall give for requiring such delivery, and 27 further, notwithstanding any delivery of the said alien as aforesaid, (2) if the above bounden obligors, or either 28 of them, shall cause the said alien to be delivered into the actual physical custody of an immigration officer, 29 upon and pursuant to his request or that of any other immigration officer, for deportation if an order of deporta- 30 tion has been made against said alien, and said alien is accepted by such immigration officer, then this obligation 31 shall be void; otherwise it shall remain in full force and virtue; Provided, that it is hereby specifically covenanted 32 and agreed by the above-bounden obligors, and each of them, that no order issued by or under the authority of 33 the Attorney General by virtue of which the said alien is or may be granted additional time to appear to defend 8203
